term.title: thermally-induced transition

item.text: A transition that is induced by a change in temperature. Example: RbNO3 undergoes three structural transitions below 573 K: trigonal → CsCl-type structure at 439 K, CsCl-type → hexagonal structure at 501 K, and hexagonal structure → NaCl-type structure at 551 K.

sources.item: PAC, 1994, 66, 577. 'Definitions of terms relating to phase transitions of the solid state (IUPAC Recommendations 1994)' on page 592 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199466030577)
